definition.name: setup-gradle
definition.description: Configures Gradle for GitHub actions, caching state and generating a dependency graph via Dependency Submission.
definition.author: gradle

inputs.name: gradle-version
inputs.description:
Gradle version to use. If specified, this Gradle version will be downloaded, added to the PATH and used for invoking Gradle.
If not provided, it is assumed that the project uses the Gradle Wrapper.

inputs.name: cache-disabled
inputs.description: When 'true', all caching is disabled. No entries will be written to or read from the cache.

inputs.name: cache-read-only
inputs.description:
When 'true', existing entries will be read from the cache but no entries will be written.
By default this value is 'false' for workflows on the GitHub default branch and 'true' for workflows on other branches.

inputs.name: cache-write-only
inputs.description:
When 'true', entries will not be restored from the cache but will be saved at the end of the Job.
Setting this to 'true' implies cache-read-only will be 'false'.

inputs.name: cache-overwrite-existing
inputs.description: When 'true', a pre-existing Gradle User Home will not prevent the cache from being restored.

inputs.name: cache-encryption-key
inputs.description:
A base64 encoded AES key used to encrypt the configuration-cache data. The key is exported as 'GRADLE_ENCRYPTION_KEY' for later steps.
A suitable key can be generated with `openssl rand -base64 16`.
Configuration-cache data will not be saved/restored without an encryption key being provided.

inputs.name: gradle-home-cache-includes
inputs.description: Paths within Gradle User Home to cache.

inputs.name: gradle-home-cache-excludes
inputs.description: Paths within Gradle User Home to exclude from cache.

inputs.name: gradle-home-cache-cleanup
inputs.description: When 'true', the action will attempt to remove any stale/unused entries from the Gradle User Home prior to saving to the GitHub Actions cache.

inputs.name: add-job-summary
inputs.description: Specifies when a Job Summary should be inluded in the action results. Valid values are 'never', 'always' (default), and 'on-failure'.

inputs.name: add-job-summary-as-pr-comment
inputs.description: Specifies when each Job Summary should be added as a PR comment. Valid values are 'never' (default), 'always', and 'on-failure'. No action will be taken if the workflow was not triggered from a pull request.

inputs.name: dependency-graph
inputs.description:
Specifies if a GitHub dependency snapshot should be generated for each Gradle build, and if so, how.
Valid values are 'disabled' (default), 'generate', 'generate-and-submit', 'generate-and-upload', 'download-and-submit' and 'clear'.

inputs.name: dependency-graph-continue-on-failure
inputs.description: When 'false' a failure to generate or submit a dependency graph will fail the Step or Job. When 'true' a warning will be emitted but no failure will result.

inputs.name: artifact-retention-days
inputs.description: Specifies the number of days to retain any artifacts generated by the action. If not set, the default retention settings for the repository will apply.

inputs.name: build-scan-publish
inputs.description:
Set to 'true' to automatically publish build results as a Build Scan on scans.gradle.com.
For publication to succeed without user input, you must also provide values for `build-scan-terms-of-use-url` and 'build-scan-terms-of-use-agree'.

inputs.name: build-scan-terms-of-use-url
inputs.description: The URL to the Build Scan® terms of use. This input must be set to 'https://gradle.com/terms-of-service' or 'https://gradle.com/help/legal-terms-of-use'.

inputs.name: build-scan-terms-of-use-agree
inputs.description: Indicate that you agree to the Build Scan® terms of use. This input value must be "yes".

inputs.name: develocity-access-key
inputs.description: Develocity access key. Should be set to a secret containing the Develocity Access key.

inputs.name: develocity-token-expiry
inputs.description: The Develocity short-lived access tokens expiry in hours. Default is 2 hours.

inputs.name: develocity-injection-enabled
inputs.description: Enables Develocity injection.

inputs.name: develocity-url
inputs.description: The URL for the Develocity server.

inputs.name: develocity-allow-untrusted-server
inputs.description: Allow communication with an untrusted server; set to _true_ if your Develocity instance is using a self-signed.

inputs.name: develocity-capture-file-fingerprints
inputs.description: Enables capturing the paths and content hashes of each individual input file.

inputs.name: develocity-enforce-url
inputs.description: Enforce the configured Develocity URL over a URL configured in the project's build; set to _true_ to enforce publication of build scans to the configured Develocity URL.

inputs.name: develocity-plugin-version
inputs.description: The version of the Develocity Gradle plugin to apply.

inputs.name: develocity-ccud-plugin-version
inputs.description: The version of the Common Custom User Data Gradle plugin to apply, if any.

inputs.name: gradle-plugin-repository-url
inputs.description: The URL of the repository to use when resolving the Develocity and CCUD plugins; the Gradle Plugin Portal is used by default.

inputs.name: gradle-plugin-repository-username
inputs.description: The username for the repository URL to use when resolving the Develocity and CCUD.

inputs.name: gradle-plugin-repository-password
inputs.description: The password for the repository URL to use when resolving the Develocity and CCUD plugins; Consider using secrets to pass the value to this variable.

inputs.name: validate-wrappers
inputs.description:
When 'true', the action will perform the 'wrapper-validation' action automatically.
If the wrapper checksums are not valid, the action will fail.

inputs.name: build-scan-terms-of-service-url
inputs.description: The URL to the Build Scan® terms of use. This input must be set to 'https://gradle.com/terms-of-service'.

inputs.name: build-scan-terms-of-service-agree
inputs.description: Indicate that you agree to the Build Scan® terms of use. This input value must be "yes".

inputs.name: generate-job-summary
inputs.description: When 'false', no Job Summary will be generated for the Job.

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.description: Gradle command line arguments (supports multi-line input)

inputs.name: build-root-directory
inputs.description: Path to the root directory of the build. Default is the root of the GitHub workspace.

inputs.name: gradle-home-cache-strict-match
inputs.description: When 'true', the action will not attempt to restore the Gradle User Home entries from other Jobs.

inputs.name: workflow-job-context
inputs.description: Used to uniquely identify the current job invocation. Defaults to the matrix values for this job; this should not be overridden by users (INTERNAL).

inputs.name: github-token
inputs.description: The GitHub token used to authenticate when submitting via the Dependency Submission API.

outputs.name: build-scan-url
outputs.description: Link to the Build Scan® generated by a Gradle build. Note that this output applies to a Step executing Gradle, not to the `setup-gradle` Step itself.

outputs.name: dependency-graph-file
outputs.description: Path to the GitHub Dependency Graph snapshot file generated by a Gradle build. Note that this output applies to a Step executing Gradle, not to the `setup-gradle` Step itself.

outputs.name: gradle-version
outputs.description: Version of Gradle that was setup by the action
